info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 12 at 7:18PM EDT until August 12 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT FOR SOUTHERN JEFFERSON...WEST CENTRAL WASHINGTON...OHIO AND BROOKE COUNTIES... At 718 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Tiltonsville, or near Wellsburg, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Steubenville, Wellsburg, West Liberty, Avella, Mingo Junction, Follansbee, Hooverson Heights, Tiltonsville, Bethany, Smithfield, Claysville, Franklin, Dillonvale, Beech Bottom, Brilliant, Windsor Heights, Rayland, New Alexandria, West Middletown, and Newell. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for east central Ohio...southwestern Pennsylvania...and northern West Virginia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
